comments.body: Do you think it's intentional for the log level to be so high for an invalid request?
It is like this in all the methods in AdminManager, but perhaps it shouldn't be? I will raise a JIRA to change it.

          val message = s"Invalid config value for resource $resource: ${e.getMessage}"
          info(message)
          resource -> ApiError.fromThrowable(new InvalidRequestException(message, e))
        case e: Throwable =>

comments.body: It's a tad vexing that we build the full synonym list only to pick the first entry when `includeSynonyms` is false. Probably not too big of a deal though.
Since it is not a performance-critical code path, it felt easier to use a single method.
nit: In scala, do we use parentheses for simple getters? I remember we don't but I very well may be wrong

we are not strictly following this. but i will update if any concerns.
cc @ijuma
